text: The Arun River () is a river that flows from Tibet to Nepal. It is a part of Koshi River which flows into India. It is known as Phung Chu or Bum-chu at Tibet, from where it starts. Around 37 percent of the total water of Koshi River comes from this river.details about flood and problems caused by river The Himalayan TimesDetails about rafting in arun river Rafting Details ==References== Category:Rivers of Nepal
title: Arun River
